page.title: 02School: Lawshall & Shimpling
page.content: We have 2 mixed Primary Schools taking pupils aged 5-9 yrs.Both schools were built in the late 1800's and currently have approx. 40 pupils on roll each,two teachers,one of which is a teaching Head and 1 part time teacher working 1 morning a week to enable the Head time for admin.work. Each school serves it's own village and surrounding area. The children living outside the village are transported by coach, provided by the local Education Authority.School hours are 9am-12noon lunch 1.10-3.10pm.Each school wears a uniform of blue & grey, although not compulsory,majority are pleased to conform & Parents are satis- fied.During the Summer Term the schools use a small outdoor swimming pool at another neighbouring school,they are taken by coach two mornings a week. These lessons are popular,and a very high percentage learn to swim.
